0.title: Biased, inaccurate: India on US body's religious freedom report
0.article_body: The latest report by United States Commission on International Religious Freedom (USCIRF) was called biased and inaccurate by Ministry of External Affairs spokesperson Arindam Bagchi on Thursday. "USCIRF is guided by...prejudices," he added. The report claimed religious freedom conditions in India "remained poor" this year. It also cited arrests of journalists Mohammed Zubair and Siddique Kappan.

1.title: Amazon faces Black Friday protests in 40 countries including India
1.article_body: Thousands of Amazon warehouse workers across about 40 countries, including India, are planning to stage protests during Black Friday sales. Employees are demanding better wages and working conditions amid the cost-of-living crisis in the 'Make Amazon Pay' campaign. The campaign is being coordinated by an international coalition of trade unions alongside environmental and civil society groups.

2.title: Ukraine should meet Russian demands to 'end suffering': Kremlin
2.article_body: Russia on Thursday said Ukraine could "end the suffering" of its people by meeting the demands of the Kremlin. Repeated missile strikes on power infrastructure across Ukraine in the past few weeks have left many parts of the country without electricity as early winter sets in. The Kremlin has denied that the strikes were aimed at civilians.

3.title: Ronaldo tears up during Portugal's national anthem, pic goes viral
3.article_body: Portugal captain Cristiano Ronaldo got emotional while his country's national anthem was being played ahead of their 2022 FIFA World Cup opener against Ghana. A picture of Ronaldo tearing up has gone viral on social media. Ronaldo is featuring in his fifth FIFA World Cup. Recently, Ronaldo and Manchester United parted ways following Ronaldo's controversial interview with Piers Morgan.

4.title: Baba Ramdev should stop using Patanjali as brand name: BJP MP
4.article_body: BJP leader Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh demanded that Baba Ramdev and Balakrishna should stop using Patanjali as their brand name. He said they built a business empire by following Maharishi Patanjali's path but did nothing for his birthplace in Uttar Pradesh's Gonda district. "Is it appropriate...to do business of ghee, oil, soap, spices, underwear, pants in his name?" he added.

5.title: Indians overtake Chinese as largest foreign students group in UK
5.article_body: Indian students have overtaken their Chinese counterparts for the first time to become the largest group of foreign students studying in the UK, said the UK Home Office. "There were 127,731 [study visa] grants to main applicant Indian nationals in the year ending September 2022, an increase of 93,470 (273%) compared to 2019," the Home Office said, explaining the development.

6.title: MCD elections to be held from 8 am-5:30 pm on Dec 4; results on Dec 7
6.article_body: Delhi's State Election Commission has announced that polls for Municipal Corporation of Delhi's (MCD) 250 wards will be held from 8 am to 5:30 pm on December 4. Polls' results will be declared on December 7. The total number of MCD wards has been reduced from 272 to 250 this year, with 42 seats reserved for Scheduled Caste (SC) candidates.

7.title: Rahul spoiling Indian culture, Gehlot should get him married: RLP chief
7.article_body: Rashtriya Loktantrik Party (RLP) chief Hanuman Beniwal said Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot should get Congress MP Rahul Gandhi married, claiming that Gandhi is spoiling Indian culture. His comments come amid Congress' ongoing Bharat Jodo Yatra, which is currently passing through Madhya Pradesh. Beniwal made the remarks while campaigning in support of Lalchand Mood for the Sardarshahar by-poll.

8.title: 2 women Maoists with ₹4 lakh reward each killed in encounter in Odisha
8.article_body: Two women Maoists, carrying a reward of ₹4 lakh each, were killed in an encounter with the Special Operation Group (SOG) of Odisha Police in Balangir district on Thursday. "Around 10:30 am, we could see the movement of four or five Maoists and there was immediate exchange of fire," DGP SK Bansal said, adding two INSAS rifles were recovered.

9.title: Iran is 'in a full-fledged human rights crisis': UN rights chief
9.article_body: United Nations Human Rights chief Volker Turk on Thursday said Iran is "in a full-fledged human rights crisis". "From what we could gather, around 14,000 people, including children, have so far been arrested (for the protests)...this is a staggering number," he said. Iranian protesters are agitating for months now over the alleged death of a woman in police custody.

10.title: Dog in US named world's oldest by Guinness World Records, pics surface
10.article_body: A California dog is now believed to be the "world's oldest", according to Guinness World Records. Gino, a 22-year-old Chihuahua from Los Angeles, was verified to be the oldest living dog on November 15. He was born on September 24, 2000. Gino was adopted by Alex Wolf in Boulder, Colorado, in 2002.

11.title: Was lovely working with Kamal Sadanah again in 'Salaam Venky': Kajol
11.article_body: Actress Kajol has said that it was "lovely" working with actor Kamal Sadanah again in 'Salaam Venky'. Kajol reunited with Kamal after they worked in the 1992 film 'Bekhudi', which was also Kajol's debut film. Speaking about being surprised to see Kamal on 'Salaam Venky' sets, Kajol said, "I kept screaming. It was just really nice."

12.title: Dengue fever kills 26 people in Sudan: Officials
12.article_body: Dengue fever has claimed 26 lives in Sudan this season, making it one of the worst outbreaks in the country in recent years, local health officials said. About 20 deaths have been recorded in Kordofan region. The Sudanese Health Ministry said as of Monday there were 3,436 suspected dengue cases in the country, of which 460 cases were confirmed.

13.title: Canadian woman's reaction on seeing her son play in FIFA World Cup goes viral
13.article_body: A video of Canadian footballer Sam Adekugbe's mother Dee Adekugbe's reaction seeing her son play in 2022 FIFA World Cup went viral. In the video, she can be seen jumping in joy and saying, "My son is in the World Cup. Thank you, Jesus. Hallelujah." Canada opened their 2022 FIFA World Cup campaign with a 0-1 defeat against Belgium.

14.title: Iran arrests football player for criticising government
14.article_body: Iranian footballer Voria Ghafouri has been arrested for criticising his country's government. Ghafouri, who isn't a part of Iran's 2022 FIFA World Cup squad, has been accused of insulting the Iranian national football team and criticising the government. Ghafouri, who is a member of Iran’s Kurdish minority, is known to have criticised Iran government's policies in the past as well.

15.title: Ford recalls over 6 lakh SUVs worldwide over fire risks
15.article_body: American automobile maker Ford Motor Company is recalling 6,34,000 sport utility vehicles (SUVs) worldwide over fire risks. "When the engine is operating, a cracked fuel injector could cause fuel and/or fuel vapour to accumulate near hot surfaces, resulting in a potential under-hood fire," Ford said. The recall affects the 2020-2023 MY Bronco Sport and Escapes with 3-cylinder, 1.5-litre engines.

16.title: B'luru law student recorded 1,200 images, videos of semi-naked women
16.article_body: A 21-year-old law student from a private college in Bengaluru, who was arrested for peeping inside a girls' toilet, recorded over 1,200 videos and images of semi-naked girls. He's also accused of clicking nude photographs of his girlfriends. He had placed a hidden camera in the toilet to record videos. He fled after some girls caught him repairing the camera.

17.title: Putin warns of 'grave consequences' to oil price caps by Western countries
17.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin during a call with Iraq's PM warned that the oil price caps the Western countries plan to introduce could have "grave consequences" for energy markets. "Such actions are contrary to the principles of market relations," Putin said. On a proposed price cap on Russian oil, US President Joe Biden on Thursday said, "It's in play."

18.title: 60 families rescued as massive landslide hits Sikkim's Pathing village
18.article_body: At least 60 families were rescued after a massive landslide hit South Sikkim's Pathing village, officials said on Thursday. The affected families were shifted to Pathing Junior High School where a relief camp has been set up, officials said. Debris from the landslide has littered the farmland below, destroying crops ready for harvest, a villager at the relief camp said.

19.title: US using Islamabad like 'hired gun': Former Pak PM Imran Khan
19.article_body: Former Pakistani Prime Minister Imran Khan has said that the US was using Islamabad like a "hired gun" in its war against terror. He said America's ties with Pakistan are "very undignified", while the US' relationship with India is a very "civilised relationship". Khan was removed from the Prime Minister's Office earlier in the year.

20.title: Doctors refuse to touch HIV positive pregnant woman in UP hospital, she loses her child
20.article_body: A 20-year-old pregnant woman was denied treatment at a hospital in Uttar Pradesh's Firozabad district as doctors allegedly refused to touch her because she was HIV positive. The medical negligence led to the woman losing her child hours after birth. A complaint has been lodged by the woman's family, an official said.

21.title: 211 crorepatis to contest in first phase of Gujarat polls: Report
21.article_body: Out of the 788 candidates contesting in the first phase of Gujarat Assembly elections, 211 are crorepatis, a report by Association for Democratic Reforms revealed. The BJP has the highest number of such candidates, with 79 having assets above ₹1 crore. Meanwhile, 65 Congress candidates are crorepatis. BJP's Ramesh Tilara, with declared assets worth ₹175 crore, is the richest candidate.

22.title: SRK thought I'd fly off train during 'Chaiyya...': Malaika Arora
22.article_body: Malaika Arora, who featured in the song 'Chaiyya Chaiyya', revealed everyone was harnessed while filming the song on the train except for her and Shah Rukh Khan. "SRK insisted I should be (harnessed) because he was worried that I might fly off the train," she added. Malaika said she was not harnessed as it would have been difficult to dance.

23.title: My choices have been wrong so audience disappeared on me: Suniel Shetty
23.article_body: Actor Suniel Shetty said he had made some wrong choices and so his audience disappeared on him. "Now, I'm trying to reinvent and make sure I play roles that suit me, I'm 61, and I'll play such roles," Shetty said. "I don't have the excitement to do more films. But, I'm still committed as an actor," he added.

24.title: Children's shelter director rapes 14-yr-old girl in Maha; arrested
24.article_body: The director of a private facility for children in Maharashtra's Nashik district has been arrested for allegedly raping a 14-year-old girl, a police official said on Thursday. The 28-year-old took the victim to a makeshift tin room in the parking area of the building, made her watch an obscene video and then raped her, he added.

25.title: Gehlot calls me nikamma, gaddar, defies my upbringing to use such words: Pilot
25.article_body: After Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot called Sachin Pilot a "gaddar" (traitor), the congress leader said it was unbecoming of an experienced person like Gehlot to use such language. Pilot said Gehlot has been calling him "nikamma, naakara", but it wasn't part of his upbringing to use such language. The priority should be to fight unitedly to defeat BJP, Pilot said.

26.title: Recall 'Amazon parcel' or send him to old age home: Uddhav on Maha Guv
26.article_body: Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray on Thursday described Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari as a "parcel" sent via Amazon by the Centre and demanded his recall over his remark on Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj. "Take this sample back or send him to an old age home. Such a slip of tongue cannot happen every time," Thackeray said.

27.title: No one should even dream that CAA will not be implemented: Amit Shah
27.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah said that no one should even dream that Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) will not be implemented. "Those who think like that are mistaken," he added. "CAA, NRC hasn't been put in...cold storage. CAA is a law...It cannot be changed now...We've to frame rules...these got delayed due to COVID-19 but the work will soon begin," Shah stated.

28.title: Wasim Jaffer names his Team India XI for first ODI against New Zealand
28.article_body: Ahead of Team India's first ODI against New Zealand on Friday, former India batter Wasim Jaffer named his Team India XI. He included captain Shikhar Dhawan and Shubman Gill as openers, followed by Shreyas Iyer, Rishabh Pant, Suryakumar Yadav, Deepak Hooda, Washington Sundar, Shardul Thakur, Deepak Chahar, Arshdeep Singh and Umran Malik.

29.title: Diamonds are a sham: Zerodha's billionaire Co-founder Nikhil Kamath
29.article_body: Zerodha's billionaire Co-founder Nikhil Kamath on Thursday tweeted, "Without sugar-coating stuff, diamonds are a sham, don't fall prey to well-thought-out marketing campaigns." Citing research, Kamath added, "If a lab-grown diamond is indistinguishable to a jeweller and costs 1/10th, logic will eventually catch up." The research shared by Kamath claimed that, unlike gold, diamonds are not rare.

30.title: Gay characters have been stereotyped in B'wood over the years: Pranay
30.article_body: Actor Pranay Manchanda, who played a gay doctor in the film 'Tara Vs Bilal', has said that "gay characters" in Hindi cinema have been portrayed in a stereotypical manner over the years. Speaking about 'Tara Vs Bilal', Pranay stated, "What this film has done beautifully with my character is, it has presented it as a fully fleshed-out character."

31.title: We're figuring out things: Suniel Shetty on KL Rahul-Athiya's wedding
31.article_body: Actor Suniel Shetty said he's aware of the rumours about his daughter Athiya Shetty and India cricketer KL Rahul's wedding. "I can tell you that I'm looking at it as in the date. With both their schedules and stuff like that, we're figuring out things," he added. Earlier, Suniel had confirmed the wedding and had said it'll happen very soon.

32.title: Akhilesh Yadav hints at contesting 2024 Lok Sabha polls from Kannauj
32.article_body: Samajwadi Party President Akhilesh Yadav on Thursday hinted that he may contest the 2024 Lok Sabha elections from Uttar Pradesh's Kannauj. "I'll contest from where I had contested the first election," he stated. However, he said the party would take a decision regarding the matter at the right time. Notably, his wife Dimple Yadav has served as Kannauj MP twice.

33.title: I hope to find scripts that do me justice: Celina Jaitly
33.article_body: Actress Celina Jaitly has said that the success of her short film 'Season's Greetings' amid the COVID-19 pandemic has "encouraged" her to return to cinema. "The only issue is there are not enough scripts that are unique and unusual just like 'Season's Greetings'...I hope to find scripts that do me justice," she further added.

34.title: Man accused of molesting minor let off with 5 sit-ups by local panchayat in Bihar
34.article_body: A man accused of molestation was let off with five sit-ups by the panchayat in Bihar's Nawada district. The accused allegedly took a minor girl to his poultry farm on pretext of giving chocolates and touched her inappropriately. The panchayat, however, concluded he was innocent and found him guilty of only taking the girl to secluded spot for unknown reasons.

35.title: Jain's continuance as Delhi minister 'shamelessness', unprecedented: Shah
35.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah on Thursday called the continuance of AAP leader Satyendar Jain as a minister in Delhi government as "shamelessness" and said such instances are unprecedented in public life. "I'd also gone to jail and resigned as a minister," Shah said. "Later, we fought before the court and the court said it was a political conspiracy," he added.

36.title: India has very exciting 2-3 decades ahead of it: Tata Sons' Chandrasekaran
36.article_body: Tata Sons Chairman Natarajan Chandrasekaran on Thursday said India has very exciting two-three decades ahead of it, as opportunities open up with disruptions in digital, supply chain and energy transmission. "It's fair to say that it is going to be India’s decade and India’s few decades," he added. He added that impact of ongoing geopolitics is working in India's favour.

37.title: Delhi's Jama Masjid agrees to revoke order restricting entry of women
37.article_body: Shahi Imam Syed Ahmed Bukhari of Delhi's Jama Masjid has agreed to revoke order restricting entry of females visiting the mosque by themselves. "[Mosque's visitors] have to maintain its sanctity," Bukhari said. He agreed to revoke the order after speaking with Delhi LG VK Saxena. Women coming alone indulge in improper acts, Jama Masjid PRO Sabiullah Khan had said.

38.title: Inmates treated uniformly: Tihar jail on Jain's 'proper food' video
38.article_body: Amid the row over Delhi minister Satyendar Jain receiving special treatment inside the Tihar jail, the prison authorities on Thursday said that all "inmates are uniformly provided with a balanced diet without any discrimination". Video clips showing Jain receiving a massage and reportedly eating "outside" food inside his jail cell were leaked to the media.

39.title: Kerala transgender couple move wedding venue after temple 'denies permission'
39.article_body: A transgender couple in Kerala's Palakkad had to move their wedding venue after officials of a temple allegedly refused to solemnise their marriage there. The pair were supposed to get married at Thiru-Kachamkurissi temple and had reportedly mentioned it as the venue in their wedding cards. Temple officials, however, said they had asked the couple to speak to higher officials.

40.title: Jama Masjid's move to ban entry of girls was unconstitutional: VHP
40.article_body: The Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) on Thursday termed Jama Masjid's earlier decision to ban entry of girls to the mosque as anti-women and unconstitutional. "Here, Muslim women [were] being deprived of their rights to offer namaz on the basis of their gender," VHP national spokesperson Vinod Bansal said. Delhi's Jama Masjid has now revoked its previous order after criticism.

41.title: India's unemployment rate falls to 7.2% in July-Sept 2022: NSO survey
41.article_body: India's unemployment rate for individuals aged 15 years and above in urban areas declined to 7.2% during July-September 2022 from 9.8% a year ago, a National Statistical Office (NSO) survey said. The unemployment rate among females fell to 9.4% in July-September 2022 from 11.6% a year ago. The unemployment rate for males fell to 6.6% against 9.3% a year ago.

42.title: Exports could slow amid global recession, uncertainties: Piyush Goyal
42.article_body: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal on Thursday said India's exports could slow amid the global recession and uncertainties. "The widening of the trade deficit is due to the rise in oil imports amid high crude oil prices," said Goyal. In October, India's trade deficit widened to $26.91 billion from $25.71 billion in September.

43.title: BJP MP meets T'gana Guv, demands inclusion of 26 communities under backward class
43.article_body: BJP MP Dr K Laxman on Thursday met Telangana Governor Dr Tamilisai Soundararajan and demanded the inclusion of 26 communities in the state's backward class (BC) list. He said these communities contain many castes including de-notified tribes and landless labourers. "When Telangana was formed in 2014, the state government...deleted the 26 communities from the backward class list," he said.

44.title: Police search Mira-Bhayandar creek for mobile phone in Shraddha case
44.article_body: Delhi Police on Thursday conducted a search in Mira-Bhayander creek near Mumbai for a mobile phone in connection with the Shraddha Walkar murder case. As per a report, the mobile tower location of the accused, Aftab Poonawala, was traced to the location of the creek. It is suspected that Aftab dumped some crucial evidence in the creek, the report added.

45.title: SC to set up fresh 5-judge bench to hear pleas against polygamy, 'nikah halala'
45.article_body: The Supreme Court (SC) has said it will set up a fresh five-judge Constitution bench to hear the pleas challenging practices of polygamy and 'nikah halala' among Muslims. This comes as two judges from the previous bench have demitted office. A Public Interest Litigation (PIL) was filed by a lawyer who sought direction to declare the practices unconstitutional and illegal.

46.title: AAP's Sandeep Bhardwaj found hanging days after being denied MCD poll ticket
46.article_body: AAP leader Sandeep Bhardwaj was found dead at his house on Thursday. Bhardwaj, who was the General Secretary of the party's trade wing in Delhi, was found hanging at his home in a case of suspected suicide. He was reportedly troubled after he wasn't given a ticket by the party for the upcoming Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) polls.

47.title: Why is Son Heung-min wearing a mask for South Korea at 2022 FIFA World Cup?
47.article_body: South Korea forward Son Heung-min has been spotted wearing a mask while playing for his country in their 2022 FIFA World Cup opener against Uruguay. The 30-year-old is wearing a protective face mask as he underwent a surgery after suffering fracture around his left eye. He had sustained the injury during a Champions League match against Marseille on November 1.

48.title: Imran Khan took to me to a nightclub in London, he ordered milk: Wasim Akram
48.article_body: Former Pakistan captain Wasim Akram has revealed once Imran Khan took him to a nightclub in London and he ordered a pint of milk. "He never drank in his life," Akram said. He added, "They got him milk in a nightclub! There was a queue of only girls to shake hands with Imran. I just said, 'That’s awesome'."

49.title: 5 knives used by Aftab to chop Shraddha's body recovered, saw missing: Reports
49.article_body: Five knives used by Aftab Poonawala to dismember his girlfriend Shraddha Walkar's body have been recovered and sent to the forensics team for investigation, a tweet by ANI said while quoting Delhi Police sources. However, a saw is still missing, reports added. The five knives reportedly measure between 5-6 inches long.

50.title: Swiss player refuses to celebrate goal against his birth-country Cameroon
50.article_body: Switzerland striker Breel Embolo scored against the land of his birth Cameroon in their FIFA World Cup Group G clash in Qatar on Thursday but refused to celebrate. "He looked almost apologetic as his teammates rushed to congratulate him," Reuters reported. The 25-year-old striker was born in Cameroon's capital Yaoundé but raised in the Swiss city of Basel.

51.title: 70% of Kyiv without electricity after Russian strikes: Mayor
51.article_body: Around 70% of Ukraine's capital was left without electricity after Russian air strikes targeted the city's energy infrastructure on Wednesday, Kyiv's mayor Vitali Klitschko said on Thursday. Klitschko said ''power engineers are doing their best" to restore electricity at the earliest. He said water supply was restored in about half of Kyiv.

52.title: Hyderabad Metro announces 'loyalty bonus' to customers via lottery
52.article_body: The Hyderabad Metro Rail on Thursday announced a 'loyalty bonus' to customers as part of their fifth-anniversary celebrations. The officials released a list of smart card IDs like the lottery system, and asked customers to contact metro officials if the customer's ID matches the smart card ID. The last date to share details is November 28, officials said.

53.title: Never legalised marriage with Ali, he cheated on me multiple times: Sara Khan
53.article_body: Actress Sara Khan opened up about her 'Bigg Boss' wedding with actor Ali Merchant and said that they never legalised their marriage. "While it never affected me professionally, I was tagged (a divorcee) unwantedly," she said. "It was so humiliating...He cheated on me multiple times, even with my co-worker," Sara said. "I caught him red-handed many times," she added.

54.title: Crypto assets worth $740 mn recovered in FTX bankruptcy so far
54.article_body: BitGo, the company tasked with locking down the assets of FTX, says it has managed to recover and secure $740 million in assets so far. The numbers were disclosed by FTX on Wednesday in court filings. The $740 million figure is from November 16. BitGo estimates the amount of recovered assets has likely risen above $1 billion since that date.

55.title: People of Delhi may gouge Kejriwal's eyes out or break his leg: BJP MP
55.article_body: BJP MP Manoj Tiwari has said that Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal may need protection from the people of Delhi, who might "gouge his eyes out or break his leg". "If the people of Delhi find him (Kejriwal) anywhere, they will beat him up. Kejriwal will be punished for his deeds," Tiwari said.

56.title: Alia Bhatt shares 1st glimpse of newborn daughter, names her Raha
56.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt has shared a glimpse of her and Ranbir Kapoor's newborn daughter. Revealing that she has been named 'Raha', Alia wrote, "The name Raha...has so many beautiful meanings...Raha, in its purest form means divine path...In Swahili she is Joy, in Sanskrit, Raha is a clan, in Bangla - rest, comfort, relief, in Arabic peace."

57.title: India showed China its place where it had to: Union Minister VK Singh
57.article_body: Union Minister General VK Singh on Thursday said Indian armed forces are prepared to face all external forces and have given befitting answers to China, when and where it was required. "India has shown China its place where it had to. Our soldiers taught them a lesson and [PM Narendra Modi's] 'lal aankh' worked where it had to," Singh added.

58.title: Nintendo's new Pokémon games record 10 million sales in 3 days of launch
58.article_body: Nintendo on Thursday said that global sales of its latest Pokémon games have surpassed 10 million units in the first three days since their launch on November 18. Pokémon Scarlet and Pokémon Violet have become the fastest selling games in Nintendo’s history, Nintendo said. The games are the first new mainline entries into the Pokémon series since 2019.

59.title: Qatar told India that Zakir Naik wasn't invited to attend FIFA: MEA
59.article_body: Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) spokesperson Arindam Bagchi on Thursday stated that Qatar has told India that no invitation was extended to Islamic preacher Zakir Naik to attend the 2022 FIFA World Cup. The issue of Naik being wanted in India was raised with Qatar, Bagchi added. Naik, who fled India in 2016, faces money laundering and hate speech charges.

60.title: Govt fixes ₹7,409 cr indicative value for Delhi's iconic Ashok hotel: Report
60.article_body: The government has set an indicative value of ₹7,409 crore for Delhi's iconic 'The Ashok' hotel under the National Monetisation Pipeline (NMP), PTI reported. The Ashok and the adjacent hotel Samrat are among the eight India Tourism Development Corporation assets listed under the NMP. The monetisation will take place through public-private partnership mode, according to the report.

61.title: Welcome for worship, not for dates: Jama Masjid on banning entry of women who come alone
61.article_body: As controversy erupted over an order restricting entry of unaccompanied women or girls to Delhi's Jama Masjid, Syed Ahmed Bukhari, the Shahi Imam, said the order is not applicable to those coming to offer prayers. "People are welcome for worship. But girls coming alone and waiting for their dates, this is not what this place is meant for," he stated.

62.title: India to grow at 'moderately brisk rate', inflation to ease: Finance Ministry
62.article_body: Indian economy is set to grow at a "moderately brisk rate" in the coming years on the back of macroeconomic stability, despite the global monetary tightening, a Finance Ministry report said. It further said inflation will ease in the coming months with the arrival of Kharif crops, and job opportunities will increase with improvement in business prospects.

63.title: Sachin Pilot is a 'gaddar' who can't be made CM: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot
63.article_body: Criticising Congress leader Sachin Pilot, Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Thursday said that he's a "gaddar" (traitor) who can't be made CM. "The High Command cannot make Sachin Pilot, a man who doesn't have 10 MLAs and who revolted, the Chief Minister. He betrayed the party, he's a traitor," Gehlot said. Pilot rebelled against the party in 2020.

64.title: Salman Rushdie's house in Himachal Pradesh attacked, caretaker gets death threat
64.article_body: The bungalow of author Salman Rushdie at Forest Road in Himachal Pradesh's Solan has been vandalised by some people. The miscreants entered the property illegally and abused the caretaker when he tried to stop them, as per reports. The miscreants also gave death threats to the caretaker. The police are investigating the matter.

65.title: BJP leader Santhosh, 3 others named accused in TRS MLAs poaching case
65.article_body: BJP's BL Santhosh and three others have been named as accused by Special Investigation Team (SIT) in the case of an alleged conspiracy to poach TRS MLAs, officials confirmed. Santhosh is also to appear before SIT for questioning. TRS' Rohith Reddy alleged he was offered ₹100 crore to leave party and contest on a BJP ticket in next Assembly polls.

66.title: 10 religious bodies ordered to remove encroachments near Pune railway station
66.article_body: Pune railway division has ordered 10 religious bodies to remove their religious structures illegally constructed on railway land near Pune railway station within 15 days. "Before taking any action on the religious structures, it is our procedure to warn them and give [them] notice," said Manoj Jhawar, Pune railway division spokesperson. The religious structures include mosques and temples.

67.title: Aftab Poonawala used to burn Shraddha Walkar with cigarettes: Friend
67.article_body: Rajat Shukla, a friend of Shraddha Walkar who was murdered by her live-in partner Aftab Poonawala, claimed Aftab used to burn Shraddha using cigarettes. He added Shraddha's friends went to Aftab's house when they came to know about it and threatened to register a police complaint. He said they didn't lodge complaint as Shraddha wanted to give him another chance.

68.title: Binance not a Chinese company, I have to repeat this because I look Chinese: CEO
68.article_body: World's biggest crypto exchange Binance's CEO Changpeng Zhao said, "Binance is not a Chinese company. We're not related to China at all." He said, "I have to repeat this many times because I look Chinese, but I've been a Canadian for 30 years." He added, "I wonder how many times I will have to repeat this one in the future."

69.title: Hyd-made satellites are for the world: Dhruva CEO ahead of satellite launch
69.article_body: Space tech startup Dhruva Space's CEO Sanjay Nekkanti said the satellites manufactured in Hyderabad are being built for the world market. "Our goal is that on every rocket that goes from India, we want to have our satellites going into space," Nekkanti added. The startup will launch its Thybolt 1 and Thybolt 2 satellites into space on November 26.

70.title: Volvo Car India announces price hike of up to 1.8% on select models
70.article_body: Volvo Car India said it will increase the prices of its three models, XC90, XC60 and XC40 Recharge, by up to 1.8% effective from November 25. The company from Sweden claimed that it has been forced to increase prices due to rising input cost pressures. The continued disruption of global supply chains has led to higher logistic costs, Volvo mentioned.

71.title: Suspect in US' LGBTQ nightclub shooting held without bail
71.article_body: The suspected gunman, who shot dead five people in an attack on an LGBTQ nightclub in the US state of Colorado last Saturday, was ordered held without bail in a court appearance on Wednesday. Anderson Aldrich is preliminarily charged with five counts of first-degree murder and five counts of bias-motivated crimes causing bodily injury.

72.title: Economic reforms to boost India's potential growth beyond 6%: Goldman
72.article_body: Goldman Sachs said India should continue with economic reforms over the medium term to boost the potential growth beyond the currently estimated 6%. "The biggest opportunity for India...is to develop globally competitive manufacturing hubs as the world restructures the supply chains," it said. Policy response of absorbing food price shocks through subsidies should continue in 2023, the firm added.

73.title: Akshay Kumar reacts to Richa's insulting tweet on Indian Army, says 'Hurts to see this'
73.article_body: Akshay Kumar reacted to Richa Chadha's insulting tweet on Indian Army. "Hurts to see this. Nothing ever should make us ungrateful towards our armed forces. Woh hain toh aaj hum hain," he wrote. Richa had tweeted, "Galwan says hi", while reacting to Northern Army Commander Lt General Upendra Dwivedi's statement that the Army is ready to take back Pakistan-occupied Kashmir.

74.title: Video shows Chennai hospital staff torturing cat, probe launched
74.article_body: A section of animal activists on Tuesday lodged a complaint with the Tamil Nadu Police, after a video of workers of a private hospital in Chennai strangulating a cat with a plastic bucket went viral. The hospital has harmed and tortured close to 20 cats with no mercy, said a complaint filed by Heaven for Animals (HFA), an NGO.

75.title: Verify Aadhaar before accepting it as a proof of identity: UIDAI
75.article_body: The Unique Identification Authority of India (UIDAI) on Thursday stated that entities must verify Aadhaar before accepting it as a proof of an individual's identity. It said the number must be verified following the consent of the Aadhaar holder. Aadhaar can be verified using the QR codes on Aadhaar letter, e-Aadhaar, Aadhaar PVC card or m-Aadhaar, the agency added.

76.title: Mumbai's new water taxi to start service between Belapur & Mandwa on Nov 26
76.article_body: Mumbai's newly-launched water taxi, Nayan XI, will begin weekend-only services between Belapur and Mandwa starting on Saturday, November 26. The ticket price will be ₹300 for the executive class and ₹400 for the business class. Water taxi services began in Mumbai in February this year. However, Nayan XI is the first and only service from the domestic cruise terminal.

77.title: Salman Khan's father gave me money after my dad's death: Sajid Khan
77.article_body: Filmmaker Sajid Khan, who is currently a contestant in the show 'Bigg Boss 16', revealed that most of his relatives did not help him after his father's demise. "Salim uncle (Salman Khan's father) came to me at my father's grave...gave me money. With that money, I could then buy ration for the next two months...pay our electricity bills," he added.

78.title: Mumbai woman tracks down conman who cheated NRI sister of ₹1.3 cr
78.article_body: A Mumbai woman tracked down 44-year-old Noida man for allegedly cheating her NRI sister of ₹1.33 crore in 2019 on the pretext of seeking investors for United States-based American Premiere League. After cheating her, the accused allegedly blocked her mobile number. But, her sister claimed she needed US visa, lured him into coming to Andheri, after which he was arrested.

79.title: Think Maha Guv will be replaced: BJP MP on Guv's remarks over Shivaji
79.article_body: After Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari was summoned to Delhi over his comments about Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj, BJP MP Chhatrapati Udayanraje Bhonsle on Thursday accused the governor of creating disharmony among people. "I think they will replace him and they should replace him," Bhonsle said. "This is not going to stop unless a solution is provided," he added.

80.title: Pune's Navale bridge witnessed 30 accidents in 2021, termed 'black spot'
80.article_body: Pune's Navale Bridge, where a 48-car pile-up incident occurred on Sunday, witnessed 30 accidents in 2021, making it the 'most dangerous patch of road' in Pune last year. At least 17 people had lost their lives. The bridge was also termed a 'black spot', a tag given to patches of roads that witness five or more accidents in three years.

81.title: Shraddha Walker murder case is not about 'love jihad': Owaisi
81.article_body: All India Majlis-E-Ittehadul Muslimeen (AIMIM) chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Thursday stated that the Shraddha Walker murder case is not about "love jihad." The MP stressed that it is a case of exploitation and abuse against a woman and that is how it should be viewed and condemned. He further criticised the BJP for giving the incident a religious angle.

82.title: Pet dog attacks woman in Gurugram, owner booked
82.article_body: The owner of a German Shepherd was booked after it attacked a woman in Gurugram. The woman said she was distributing her friend's wedding invites in her locality when her neighbour's dog came running out of the house and bit her. She suffered injuries on her mouth and hand. She said the dog had earlier bitten her father as well.

83.title: Traffic diversions issued in Hyderabad's Gachibowli until November 30
83.article_body: Hyderabad Traffic Police issued traffic diversions in Gachibowli between Honeywell and Sattva Knowledge Capital from 23 to 30 November due to road construction. Vehicles on their way from One West Building to Hyatt Hyderabad junction will be diverted through Wave Rock intersection. Moreover, traffic coming from ICICI Bank junction to One West Building will be diverted via Hyatt Hyderabad junction.

84.title: Apple looks to buy Manchester United in over ₹57,430 crore deal: Report
84.article_body: Technology giant Apple is interested in buying Manchester United football club in a £5.8 billion (over ₹57,430 crore) deal, The Daily Star reported. Apple CEO Tim Cook is keen to explore the opportunities owning United could provide and will hold talks with the banks appointed to oversee the sale, the report added. Cook also plans to build a new stadium.

85.title: Football fan caught trying to sneak alcohol into Qatar stadium in binoculars
85.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media that showed how a Mexican football fan who was trying to sneak alcohol into the Qatar stadium by hiding it in his binoculars was caught by security. Just days ahead of the FIFA World Cup 2022, the authorities announced that alcohol will be banned for World Cup fans at the grounds.

86.title: Rival Samsung is Apple's largest supplier of iPhone 14's OLED display: Report
86.article_body: Samsung Display is expected to account for over 70% of the OLED panels used by rival Apple for the iPhone 14 models by the end of the year, according to a report by The Elec. Apple is expected to use over 120 million OLED panels for iPhone 14, and Samsung is expected to ship over 80 million of those units.

87.title: 18-year-old Indian-origin student stabbed to death outside a school in Canada
87.article_body: An 18-year-old Indian-origin boy was stabbed to death at a high school parking lot by another teenager in Canada's British Columbia province, police said. The victim was identified as Mehakpreet Sethi. The principal of the school confirmed on Tuesday that a fight took place in the parking lot but the victim was not the student of the school.

88.title: Republican urges Twitter CEO Musk to better protect US user data
88.article_body: Republican lawmaker Chuck Grassley has urged Twitter CEO Elon Musk to conduct a threat assessment at the company to better protect Americans' user data. This comes after a whistleblower, Peiter Zatko, testified in September that a foreign agent could use malware to steal Twitter users' personal information. Zatko served as Twitter's head of security before he was fired in January.

89.title: Satyendar Jain withdraws plea to stop media from airing jail videos, to move HC
89.article_body: Delhi minister Satyendar Jain on Thursday withdrew his plea from a Delhi court seeking directions to restrain media from airing any CCTV footage of him from the prison. He said he would move the High Court instead. Recently, CCTV clips showing the AAP leader getting a massage and eating food inside his cell at Tihar jail went viral.

90.title: Kamal Haasan recovering, will be discharged in a day or two: Hospital
90.article_body: A statement from Sri Ramachandra Hospital has informed that actor Kamal Haasan is "recovering well and will be discharged in a day or two". The actor was admitted to hospital on Wednesday. He was suffering from mild fever, cough and cold. On the work front, Kamal Haasan is currently busy with the shooting of 'Indian 2'.

91.title: SRK told me, 'There's grammar attached to each film': Vicky Kaushal
91.article_body: Actor Vicky Kaushal has said that he learned a "very interesting" thing from actor Shah Rukh Khan. "[SRK] told me there is always a grammar attached to every film and it comes with the director, what vision he has," he added. Vicky stated that it is important for him to understand the grammar that the director is coming up with.

92.title: Agastya reminded me of Abhishek Bachchan: 'The Archies' actress
92.article_body: Actress Tara Sharma Saluja, who will be seen in Zoya Akhtar's 'The Archies', said that her co-star Agastya Nanda reminded her of actor Abhishek Bachchan. "You good naturedly making fun of me on set reminds me of Abhishek and your polite, gentle warmth and talent is endearing," she wrote in an Instagram post. Agastya is Abhishek's nephew.

93.title: CoinDCX publishes Proof of Reserves, CEO says firm to increase transparency
93.article_body: Crypto exchange CoinDCX published its Proof-of-Reserves on November 24. "With this, CoinDCX's on-chain and off-chain asset balances and a complete list of wallet addresses are available for public viewing," the company said in its statement. CEO Sumit Gupta said the company will take more steps towards increased transparency in the coming days, including publishing its Proof of Liability.

94.title: I don't care, not our problem: Ghana coach on Ronaldo's Man Utd exit
94.article_body: Ghana manager Otto Addo said he doesn't know whether Portuguese footballer Cristiano Ronaldo's recent exit from Manchester United is capable of being a distraction for his team, adding that he "doesn't care". "This is not our problem...It's a...big game...so I don't think...this can distract anyone," he stated. Ghana will face Portugal in their 2022 FIFA World Cup opener.

95.title: indiagold raises $10 mn from PayU, others in extended Series A round
95.article_body: Fintech startup indiagold has secured $10 million in an extended Series A funding round which saw participation from existing investors including PayU, Leo Capital and Alpha Wave, among others. The company had raised $12 million in the first tranche of the fundraise that took place in August 2021. Two former Paytm executives, Deepak Abbot and Nitin Misra, founded the company.

96.title: Wild dog gnawing on a US-given bone: Kim Jong Un's sister on S Korea
96.article_body: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un's sister on Thursday described South Korea's new president and his administration as "idiots" and "a running wild dog gnawing on a bone given by the US". Kim Yo Jong made the comments alluding to the South Korean Foreign Ministry's recent statement that it was reviewing additional sanctions against North Korea over recent missile tests.

97.title: I had a huge crush on Sania Mirza: Varun Dhawan
97.article_body: Varun Dhawan revealed he had a crush on Sania Mirza when he worked in a production company on her ad. Varun added Sania asked for an apple. Varun stated Sania's mother assumed he was "crack" as his hands were trembling while giving her the apple. "[Sania's mother] asked 'Who told you to bring...apple?'...[Sania]...said I want the apple," he said.

98.title: India setting benchmark for innovation, has potential to go global: Ajit Mohan
98.article_body: Ajit Mohan, Snap's president of APAC region, said the country is setting the benchmark for innovation and products that don't exist anywhere. The former Meta India head added that a decade ago, India used to refer to successful Western models that could be replicated in the country, but now has a potential to go global with its fairly unique models.

99.title: Financial services tech provider FIS to lay off thousands of employees: Report
99.article_body: Florida-based financial services technology provider FIS plans to dismiss several thousand employees from a workforce that numbered about 65,000 at the end of last year, Bloomberg reported. The move comes after FIS' shares fell 44% this year. The layoffs are reportedly a part of incoming CEO Stephanie Ferris' plan to cut costs by at least $500 million in coming quarters.

100.title: AIIMS Delhi issues guidelines for manual admission till e-hospital server down
100.article_body: AIIMS Delhi on Thursday issued a fresh set of Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) which says admission, discharge and transfer of patients will be done manually at the hospital till e-hospital server is down. Notably, the server has been down for more than 24 hours now affecting services like smart lab, billing and report generation of outpatient and inpatient departments.

101.title: Stories about women are far more juicy & entertaining: Ekta Kapoor
101.article_body: Filmmaker Ekta Kapoor said that she has an "absolute belief" that stories about women are "far more juicy...entertaining and far more multi-dimensional than stories about men". "You make stories about women, and you realise the actual meaning of multitasking and navigation," she said. "Homegrown stories about women - I love that kind of storytelling the most," she added.

102.title: Woman, 4-yr-old son burnt alive as LPG cylinder explodes at J&K house
102.article_body: A 40-year-old woman and her four-year-old son were burnt alive after an LPG cylinder caught fire and exploded at their home in Jammu and Kashmir's Poonch on Thursday. The deceased were identified as Hamida Begum and Aqib Ahmed. Hamida's husband and two children narrowly escaped the fire, police said. They added that 12 domesticated animals also died in the incident.

103.title: B'luru to host 14th edition of Aero India, Asia's biggest airshow, in 2023
103.article_body: Bengaluru will host the 14th edition of Aero India, which is considered to be Asia's biggest airshow, in 2023. The show is expected to be held at the Air Force Station in Yelahanka, which has been the designated venue since 1996, according to reports. During the biennial airshow, manufacturers and service providers from the Indian aerospace industry meet potential customers.

104.title: Russian parliament passes law expanding ban on 'LGBTQ propaganda'
104.article_body: Russian parliament has passed the third and final reading of a law that expands the existing ban on "LGBTQ propaganda". Under the new law, any event or act perceived as an attempt to promote LGBTQ rights, including films, books or advertisements, will incur a fine. Individuals will face $6,600 fine while legal entities will face $82,100 fine.

105.title: Exporters seek fiscal support, affordable credit in Budget 2023
105.article_body: Federation of Indian Export Organisations (FIEO) on Thursday demanded measures such as creation of a fund and credit at affordable rates in the upcoming Budget to boost the exports and create jobs. During a pre-budget meeting with Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, the federation asked for a 200% tax deduction on the expenditure made by exporters for overseas marketing.

106.title: Is this Iran, asks DCW on Jama Masjid banning entry of women going alone
106.article_body: Soon after Jama Masjid barred the entry of women going alone, DCW chief Swati Maliwal said, "Do they think this is Iran, where they can discriminate against women and no one will say anything?" DCW has sought to know the reasons for prohibiting the entry of women and girls "without male companions" to the Jama Masjid.

107.title: Japan's 2-1 win against Germany isn't a big surprise: Jose Mourinho
107.article_body: Portuguese manager Jose Mourinho said 24th-ranked Japan's 2-1 win against four-time champions Germany in their 2022 FIFA World Cup opener isn't a "big surprise". "In European football, there is a big focus on the individual...[and on] egos," added Mourinho. "I have coached the best Asian player Son Heung-min and I understand that the mentality is really special," he stated.

108.title: Credit Suisse flags Q4 loss of $1.6 bn, may cut 9,000 jobs by 2025
108.article_body: Credit Suisse said on Wednesday that it projects a 1.5 billion Swiss franc ($1.6 billion) loss in the fourth quarter driven by subdued client activity in the wealth management and Swiss bank division. Bloomberg reported that in a bid to cut costs, the bank has started slashing 2,700 jobs in Q4 and plans to cut around 9,000 positions by 2025.

109.title: Leopard enters residential building near Mumbai, attacks people; video surfaces
109.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing a leopard venturing into a residential building in Kalyan near Mumbai. The leopard attacked several people in the area. "The leopard has been kept captive and we're awaiting a cage into which it will be shifted (for evacuation from the site)," an official said. At least three people were injured, as per reports.

110.title: Ramesh Chauhan denies selling Bisleri to Tata Consumer Products, says 'talks are still on'
110.article_body: Bisleri International's 82-year-old Chairman Ramesh Chauhan said that he is in talks with potential buyers for the company, including Tata Consumer Products. Chauhan also denied a report that a ₹7,000 crore deal has been completed with Tata Consumer Products. He added that he is looking for someone to handle the business as his daughter Jayanti is not interested in it.

111.title: BJP committed to bringing UCC once democratic debates are over: Shah
111.article_body: Union Minister Amit Shah on Thursday said BJP is committed to bringing the Uniform Civil Code after all democratic debates and discussions are concluded. "Not only BJP [but] the Constituent Assembly had also advised the Parliament and states to bring UCC at an opportune time because, for any secular country, laws shouldn't be on the basis of religion," Shah added.

112.title: Thane civic body seizes 47 kg banned plastic, collects ₹15,000 fine from shops
112.article_body: The Thane Municipal Corporation (TMC), as a part of the plastic ban campaign, took action against 25 shops, confiscated 47 kg of banned plastic and recovered ₹15,000 fine since November 22. TMC took action on shops in Kopri, Uthalsar and Khopat area. TMC is also creating awareness among citizens to avoid the use of single use plastic through various mediums.

113.title: Bankrupt FTX's ex-CEO lists 5 things he wishes he would have done differently
113.article_body: Sam Bankman-Fried, the ex-CEO of crypto exchange FTX that filed for bankruptcy, shared five things he wishes he'd done differently. These include being more skeptical of large-margin positions, examining stress test scenarios and being more careful about fiat processes on FTX. He also regretted not having regular monitoring of core risk metrics and putting more controls around margin management.

114.title: Rohit, Kohli need to change approach, increase strike rate: Harbhajan
114.article_body: Ex-India spinner Harbhajan Singh said Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli and KL Rahul need to increase their strike rate and change their approach. "It is tough when you bat at...[a strike rate of] 110 and...[target] 180," added Harbhajan. "England changed their approach and they have won two World Cups. T20s have to be played like T20s, not like ODIs," he stated.

115.title: Maha Guv has crossed all limits: Pawar on Guv's remarks over Shivaji
115.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Thursday criticised Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari for calling Shivaji Maharaj an 'old idol' and said he has "crossed all the limits". "I think the President and the PM should take a decision (about Koshyari)," Pawar said. "Such people should not be given crucial posts," Pawar said, adding the post of governor represents an institution.

116.title: T'gana minister booked for snatching laptop & evidence from I-T officials
116.article_body: Telangana minister Malla Reddy has been booked for allegedly forcefully snatching a laptop, mobile phone and evidence from an Income Tax officer on duty, according to police officials. A case has been registered under IPC sections 353 and 506 against the minister, officials said. Responding to the allegations, Reddy said, "I didn't tear any documents or snatch any laptop."

117.title: Restores faith in judiciary: NCP on SC questioning EC's appointment
117.article_body: The Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) on Thursday welcomed the Supreme Court questioning the speed of Election Commissioner Arun Goel’s appointment. Many questions arose regarding the matter, NCP National Spokesperson, Clyde Crasto, said. "Supreme Court asking for files and showing unhappiness over the appointment during the hearing of petitions restores our faith in our judiciary," Crasto stated.

118.title: Guard felicitated for saving woman who jumped into pond in Navi Mumbai
118.article_body: Sujata Dhole, the Additional Commissioner of Navi Mumbai Municipal Corporation, felicitated a security guard for saving a young woman who had jumped into a pond in Navi Mumbai in October. The woman had reportedly jumped into the pond after shouting someone's name. Nitin Kindare, who was on duty in the area, jumped into the pond to save her.

119.title: BJP worker asks to caption Rahul's pic with Rajasthan MLA Divya, she gives 7 captions
119.article_body: BJP worker Arun Yadav shared a photo of Rahul Gandhi kissing Rajasthan MLA Divya Maderna's head during Bharat Jodo Yatra and asked his followers to caption it. Maderna gave seven captions, writing, "Elder brother, protector, guardian". She also wrote, "Shame on you. You might also have a daughter, wife, mother. Stop character assassination. Find some better ways to target politically."

120.title: Madrasas under Uttarakhand Waqf Board to get uniforms, NCERT books
120.article_body: Uttarakhand Waqf Board Chairman has said that all madrasas under it will get a uniform dress code and classes from 8 am to 2 pm like any "regular school". "So far madrasas were known only for Muslim students, but we plan to teach students from every community," he added. NCERT books will also be implemented in madrasas, he further said.

121.title: Drones, crackers banned within 3 km radius of Air Force Station in Gurugram
121.article_body: The district administration has banned the use of drones and the bursting of crackers during wedding ceremonies at banquet halls located within a 3 km radius of the Air Force station on Old Delhi-Gurugram Road. The decision came as the IAF has its ammunition depot at the station. Such activities pose a potential threat to the national interest, IAF stated.

122.title: USFDA classifies Cipla's Goa unit as OAI, product approvals to be hit
122.article_body: The US Food and Drug Administration (USFDA) has classified drug major Cipla's Goa plant as 'Official Action Indicated' (OAI). The move will impact product approvals from the facility meant for the US market. According to the USFDA definition, OAI means "objectionable conditions were found and regulatory administrative sanctions by FDA are indicated" during inspections.

123.title: 2 dead, 42 hospitalised due to diarrhoea after drinking dirty water in Chhattisgarh
123.article_body: Two people died and 42 were hospitalised due to diarrhoea after drinking dirty water in Bhilai in Chhattisgarh's Durg district. According to Durg Collector Pushpendra Kumar Meena, drinking water pipeline was laid along drains in most of the colonies under Amrit Mission. Due to this, sometimes harmful elements enter the pipelines and contaminate water, causing problems like diarrhoea, he added.

124.title: PM should speak on BJP's misrule in Gujarat instead of cursing Congress: Kharge
124.article_body: Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge criticised PM Narendra Modi over his attack on the party during the campaign in Gujarat and said that instead of cursing the Congress, he should speak about the BJP's "misrule" in the state. "Why was the future of children of Gujarat spoiled? Why Gujarat ranks 29th among 30 states/UT in malnourished, underweight children?" Kharge questioned PM.

125.title: 2 domestic helpers sedate guard, 4 dogs to rob employer in Punjab
125.article_body: Two Nepali domestic helpers allegedly gave food laced with sedatives to a watchman and four dogs and decamped with valuables from their employer's house in Punjab's Ludhiana. They stole a gun, 25 live cartridges, ₹2.5 lakh cash, gold and diamond jewellery, and ransacked the house. The house owner was attending a wedding in Shimla at the time.

126.title: All that mattered are gone just like that: Mahesh on father Krishna
126.article_body: In a note, remembering his late father and actor Krishna, Mahesh Babu wrote that his inspiration, courage, and all that he "looked up to" and "really mattered are gone just like that". "But strangely, I feel this strength in me which I never really felt before. I will carry your legacy forward...make you even more proud...My superstar," the actor added.

127.title: BBMP begins 'rapid work' on pilot basis on Old Madras Road
127.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) on Tuesday began a "rapid road work" on a 500-metre stretch at Binnamangala junction, where 100 Feet Road and Old Madras Road meet. The project, which has been undertaken on a pilot basis, will pave 5-foot-wide, 2-foot-long and 7-inch-thick concrete slabs on the road and is seen as an alternative to white-topping.

128.title: Reformist leader Anwar Ibrahim named Malaysia's next PM
128.article_body: Malaysia's reformist leader Anwar Ibrahim was named the country's new prime minister on Thursday, days after the general elections ended in a hung Parliament. In the elections, Anwar's Alliance of Hope won 82 seats which is below the 112 seats needed for majority. The United Malays National Organization has agreed to support a unity government under Anwar.

129.title: They say they have been silenced, by who: Roy Keane on Germany
129.article_body: Talking about the German players covering their mouths with hands during team photo before their 2022 FIFA World Cup opener against Japan, ex-Manchester United captain Roy Keane said, "They say they've been silenced, by who?" "They can...do a lot more...Leadership's about action, go and do it," added Keane. The German players were protesting against the pro-LGBTQ 'OneLove' armband ban.

130.title: Air pollution caused 2.38 lakh premature deaths in Europe in 2020: Report
130.article_body: At least 2,38,000 people prematurely died in the European Union due to exposure to fine particulate matter (PM2.5) in 2020, the European Environment Agency (EEA) said. This happened when emissions fell due to COVID-19 restrictions. According to EEA, 96% of the EU's urban population was exposed to concentrations of PM2.5 above the level in World Health Organization guidelines.

131.title: RTI portal to help people access information about SC made operational
131.article_body: An online portal for filing Right To Information (RTI) applications to help people access information about the Supreme Court was operationalised on Thursday. At the outset of the hearing, CJI DY Chandrachud said the portal will start functioning soon. "If there is some problem, get back to me…I will be more than happy to look into it," the CJI said.

132.title: Sensex rises by 762 points to close at record high of 62,272
132.article_body: Sensex hit a new high on Thursday and closed 762 points higher at 62,272 points on the monthly expiry day of derivative (F&O) contracts. Nifty ended at a record-high of 18,484.10 points gaining 1.2%. HDFC Life, Apollo Hospitals and BPCL were the top movers on Nifty, while Infosys, HDFC Bank and RIL were the top contributors to the Sensex rally.

133.title: Those who ill-treated people from Bihar are now with BJP in Maha: Aaditya
133.article_body: Ex-Maharashtra minister Aaditya Thackeray has said those who "ill-treated people from Bihar" are now with BJP in Maharashtra. "Everyone existed [under MVA government] peacefully...[Our administration worked] according to the Constitution and the state was moving forward," he said. Thackeray's comments came as he met Bihar CM Nitish Kumar and Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav in Patna on Wednesday.

134.title: Over 6,000 govt schools in Himachal have less than 20 students: Report
134.article_body: A total of 6,106 government schools in Himachal Pradesh have less than 20 students each, according to a report by Unified District Information System for Education. This includes 5,113 primary and 993 middle schools. The report also said that 12 primary government schools do not have any teacher, while 2,969 have one teacher each.

135.title: Udaan raises new debt funding days after $120 mn fundraise & layoffs
135.article_body: B2B e-commerce startup Udaan has raised fresh debt funds from Temasek-backed EvolutionX Debt Capital which is reportedly $35-40 million. Udaan's debt financing in the last four quarters has reached around $400 million. In November, the company fired 350 employees in second round of layoffs which came just days after it raised $120 million in convertible notes and debt from shareholders.

136.title: Hyd Police to impose traffic diversions from Jubilee Hills to Durgam Cheruvu
136.article_body: The Hyderabad Traffic Police is going to introduce traffic diversions on trial basis for vehicles traveling from Jubilee Hills to Durgam Cheruvu in a move to ease traffic movement at Jubilee Hills. The diversions will come into effect from today and will continue for a week. The police also shared list of alternative routes to take during this period.

137.title: ICICI Bank to buy 10% stake in JV between Indian Oil, Chennai Petroleum
137.article_body: ICICI Bank is set to buy a 10% stake in the proposed oil refining joint venture between Indian Oil Corporation Ltd (IOCL) and Chennai Petroleum Corporation Ltd (CPCL). The proposed joint venture plans to establish a petroleum refinery in Tamil Nadu's Nagapattinam, according to bank's exchange filing. IOCL and CPCL will hold a stake of 25% each in the refinery.

138.title: Recession unlikely in Asia-Pacific region in 2023: Moody's
138.article_body: A recession is unlikely in the Asia-Pacific (APAC) region in 2023, although the area will suffer from higher interest rates and slower global trade growth, Moody's Analytics said. Moody's said India is headed for slower growth next year, more in line with its long-term potential. However, inward investment and productivity gains in technology and agriculture could accelerate growth, it added.

139.title: Manchester United co-owner ignores journalist over question on Ronaldo, video goes viral
139.article_body: Manchester United co-owner Avram Glazer ignored a journalist after the latter asked him about Cristiano Ronaldo's exit. A video of the same has gone viral on social media. In the video, the journalist can be heard asking, "Why did he have to leave the club?" after which Glazer ignores him and goes away.

140.title: World's oldest living cat confirmed at almost 27 years old; pics surface
140.article_body: A British cat named 'Flossie' has been recognised as the oldest living cat by the Guinness World Records. At the age of 26 years 329 days, roughly the feline equivalent of 120 human years, the record-breaking pet is in good health, although poorly sighted and deaf. The oldest cat who ever lived was aged 38 years and 3 days.

141.title: Polygraph test reveals Aftab used more than 1 weapon to chop Shraddha's body: Reports
141.article_body: Aftab Poonawala, who underwent a polygraph test on Thursday, used more than one weapon to chop Shraddha Walkar's body, reports said. His body language during the test was normal, reports added. Aftab's narco analysis will be done following his polygraph test which will take place during his judicial custody which ends on Saturday.

142.title: A lot of newcomers have the victim syndrome: Luv Ranjan on nepotism
142.article_body: Filmmaker Luv Ranjan, speaking about nepotism in the film industry, has said that many newcomers have the victim syndrome. "We get stuck up in the notion that I'm good. But it doesn't mean that others are bad. People don't realize that filmmaking cannot be detached from business," he added. Luv stated that nepotism in the industry is a "sour topic".

143.title: Kitchen robotics startup Nosh raises $1 million in pre-seed round
143.article_body: Bengaluru-based robotics startup Nosh, which uses artificial intelligence to ensure food consistency and taste, has raised $1 million in a pre-seed round led by BITS Spark. SuperMorpheus and other angel investors also participated in the funding round. Nosh is an app-driven cooking robot, developed by Euphotic Labs, that cooks an extensive range of dishes automatically.

144.title: Man poses as 'Rajasthani royal' in Mumbai, blackmails 50 women with personal pics
144.article_body: Mumbai Police on Tuesday arrested a 25-year-old man, Pukraj Dewasi alias Rajveer Singh, for allegedly threatening over 50 women to upload their personal photos on social media. According to police, Singh would pose as a royal, post photos of himself inside Rajasthani palaces and befriend women. After befriending women, he would eventually request personal photos, which he used for extortion.

145.title: MNS workers slap Navi Mumbai hotel manager for not playing Marathi songs
145.article_body: Workers of Raj Thackeray-led Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) slapped the manager of a hotel in Navi Mumbai after he refused to play Marathi songs in the hotel during a party, reports said. A video purportedly showed the workers arguing with the manager before slapping him. The incident took place in Vashi area.

146.title: Hospital employee in Pune kills wife by injecting lethal drugs, arrested
146.article_body: A 23-year-old male nurse working at a hospital in Pune district was arrested for allegedly killing his wife by administering her lethal injections, police said. The accused, Swapnil Sawant, tried to pass it off as a suicide. Sawant had an affair with a nurse at the hospital and decided to marry her, police said. He wanted to eliminate his wife.

147.title: Nearly ₹400 crore tax deposited through 5 lakh updated ITRs: Official
147.article_body: The government has received ₹400 crore tax after five lakh updated income tax returns (ITRs) were filed, a senior official said. The ITR-U form was made available in May for taxpayers to update their ITRs for fiscal years starting 2019-20. The Budget 2022-23 permitted taxpayers to update their ITRs within two years of filing, subject to payment of taxes.

148.title: Sensex hits all-time high at over 62,300, Nifty tops 18,450
148.article_body: The Sensex on Thursday hit an all-time high of 62,333 after zooming over 800 points. The Nifty50 index was up 225 points at around 18,492. Domestic markets extended gains in Thursday's intra-day trade after minutes from the November meeting revealed that the US Federal Reserve officials expect to switch to smaller interest rate increases "soon".

149.title: 'Ban on non-Hindu shops' posters put up at K'taka's Subramanya temple
149.article_body: Hindu Jagaran Vedike has put up posters at Karnataka's Kukke Subramanya temple, "banning" shops belonging to non-Hindus, reports said. The poster reads, "As the 'Champa Sashti' festival will be celebrated at Kukke Subramanya, the shops and stalls of other communities, except Hindus, are banned around the temple." The festival is slated to begin next week.

150.title: 'Automatic seat cover up' installed in western-style toilets at CSMT
150.article_body: The Central Railway has installed 'automatic seat cover up' arrangement in western-style toilets at Mumbai's Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus (CSMT) to ensure better hygiene for passengers. A seat cover will remain in the down position when someone is using the toilet, otherwise it will lift up automatically. The arrangement acts mechanically with the help of springs and other objects.

151.title: Over 500 people fall ill after having food at a wedding in Bihar
151.article_body: Over 500 people fell ill after consuming adulterated food at a wedding in Bihar's Madhepura district. They have been admitted to the JanNayak Karpoori Thakur Medical College and Sadar hospitals. The patients complained of abdominal pain, vomiting, headache and fever a few hours after having the food. Around 2,000 people were invited to the wedding.

152.title: Potential funding interest came in 8 mins after I filed bankruptcy docs: FTX ex-CEO
152.article_body: After the collapse of crypto exchange FTX, its former CEO Sam Bankman-Fried sent an apology letter to its employees. Listing the reasons that led to the company's breakdown, he wrote, "I disappointed all of you...We likely could have raised significant funding; potential interest in billions of dollars of funding came in roughly eight minutes after I signed...Chapter 11 docs."

153.title: B'luru man missing since murder of 2-yr-old daughter arrested after 8 days
153.article_body: An ex-IT sector employee was arrested in Bengaluru in connection with his two-year-old daughter's murder after being on run for eight days. Hours after Rahul Parmar and his daughter Jiya went missing from their residence on November 15, Jiya's body was found in a Kolar lake. Rahul had reportedly lost his job earlier this year and was under financial strain.

154.title: Delhi's Jama Masjid to allow entry for women only if they come with family, husband
154.article_body: Delhi's Jama Masjid on Thursday banned the entry of women who come alone or in groups to the mosque. Married couples and women visiting Jama Masjid with families are, however, exempted from the ban. Issuing a notice to the mosque's Imam, DCW chief Swati Maliwal tweeted, "As much as a man has the right to worship, so does a woman."

155.title: Felt lost after Vicky Donor's success, had to rediscover myself: Yami
155.article_body: Actress Yami Gautam said that right after the success of 'Vicky Donor', she felt "lost" and wasn't able to connect to the opportunities that she was receiving at that time. She said she "had to rediscover" herself and understand her purpose of coming into Bollywood. "It took me a while to understand myself...how to channelise my voice," she added.

156.title: Thane civic body’s tax collection crosses ₹500 crore-mark this year
156.article_body: The Thane Municipal Corporation (TMC) on Wednesday crossed the ₹500 crore-mark in tax collection this financial year so far, a civic official said. The tax collection so far this year has been ₹502.12 crore and the maximum collection of ₹173.98 crore came from the Majiwada-Manpada ward, Municipal Commissioner Abhijit Bangar said.

157.title: Tried to play safe with Raksha Bandhan, failed miserably: Aanand L Rai
157.article_body: Filmmaker Aanand L Rai said he "played safe" with 'Raksha Bandhan', which is why it "failed miserably". "There were some expectations...I was unable to deliver," Aanand shared. He said that his "biggest mistake" while making the film was "differentiating" between the audiences. "I thought...let me cater to audience in the B and C tier cities...that's not my job," he concluded.

158.title: K-pop band BTS' member Jin to begin military service on Dec 13: Report
158.article_body: K-pop band BTS' oldest member Jin will begin his mandatory military service on December 13, South Korean newspaper reported citing military authorities. Jin, who will turn 30 on December 4, will receive five weeks of training at a bootcamp before being deployed to a unit. The seven-member band planned to pursue individual projects and reunite in 2025 after finishing service.

159.title: Girlfriend dumps body of man in B'luru after he dies of epileptic attack during sex
159.article_body: A probe into the death of a 67-year-old man, whose body was found in Bengaluru on November 17, has revealed that he died of an epileptic attack while having sex with his girlfriend. The 35-year-old woman, along with her relatives, dumped the body at an isolated spot, as she didn't want anyone to know about her relationship with the deceased.

160.title: Bangalore Literature Festival to be organised on December 3, 4
160.article_body: The 11th edition of the Bangalore Literature Festival (BLF) will be organised on the lawns of the Lalit Ashok Hotel on Kumara Krupa road on December 3, 4 after a gap of two COVID-19 impacted years. This year's edition will feature more than 250 international, Indian, and city authors and speakers, four programme forums and two children's venues, reports said.

161.title: 6 including woman beat history-sheeter to death in Pune; 3 arrested
161.article_body: Six people, including a woman allegedly attacked a history-sheeter with a sickle and beat him to death in Pune's Nana Peth. A senior police inspector said that three of the accused have been arrested while a search is underway to catch the other three. "Prima facie, the murder is the outcome of an old rivalry," the senior police inspector added.

162.title: When sh**ty things happen, we tend to take irrational decisions: FTX ex-CEO
162.article_body: Former FTX CEO Sam Bankman-Fried sent an apology letter to the employees of the bankrupt cryptocurrency exchange. He wrote, "I feel deeply sorry about what happened…I froze up in the face of pressure and leaks and the Binance LOI and said nothing...Nothing that happened was your fault….When sh**ty things happen to us, we all tend to make irrational decisions."

163.title: I've my eye on Shraddha murder case, killer will get strictest punishment: Amit Shah
163.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Thursday said that Delhi Police will ensure that Shraddha Walkar's killer will get the strictest punishment at the earliest, adding, "I've my eye on the matter." "Shraddha had sent a letter to Maharashtra Police saying that she would be killed and cut into pieces. Even after that, no action was taken," he added.

164.title: Pope compares war in Ukraine to 1930s famine caused by Stalin
164.article_body: Pope Francis compared Russian war in Ukraine to the "terrible genocide" of the 1930s, saying that "the extermination by famine was...caused by Stalin". During his address at St Peter's Square in Vatican City, Pope Francis mentioned "Holodomor", or death by starvation and said that Ukrainians were suffering today from "martyrdom of aggression". "Let's pray for victims of...genocide," he added.

165.title: 'Rats ate 580 kg of weed', says UP's Mathura Police; court demands proof
165.article_body: Uttar Pradesh's Mathura Police submitted a report to a special Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act (1985) court, claiming that rats "ate" over 580 kg of confiscated weed stored in warehouses. Following the police report, the court asked the police to get rid of the "mice menace" and deliver proof that the rats actually ate the weed worth ₹60 lakh.

166.title: Uber, 2 delivery apps propose offering Mexico drivers social security
166.article_body: Uber and delivery apps DiDi and Rappi on Wednesday said they're open to offering Mexico drivers and couriers social security benefits. According to their statement, those who work an average of over 40 hours a week on one or more platforms can be eligible for the benefits. This comes ahead of a bill in Mexico that will regulate gig economy.

167.title: Muslim students beaten in Guj over 'love jihad' allegations, video surfaces
167.article_body: A group of men, reportedly belonging to Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP), assaulted three Muslim college students in Gujarat on Wednesday over 'love jihad' allegations. A two-minute video of the incident has gone viral on the internet, showing a group of men wearing handkerchiefs as masks as they assault the three students.

168.title: Nations far away from US may see improvement in Twitter's speed: Musk
168.article_body: Days after saying that Twitter is "very slow" in India and many other countries, CEO Elon Musk said on Thursday there could be improvements to Twitter's speed. "You might notice small...major improvements in speed of Twitter...Will be especially significant in countries far away from USA," posted Musk. "Sometimes, it doesn't work at all, especially on Android phones," he had said.

169.title: Traffic movement to remain affected on Delhi's Ring Road for nearly 11 months
169.article_body: Traffic movement on Delhi's Ring Road in both the carriageways from Rajouri Garden towards Punjabi Bagh and vice-versa will remain affected for nearly 11 months, the Delhi Traffic Police said in an advisory. The traffic will remain hit due to the construction of an elevated road from New Moti Nagar flyover to ESI Hospital, the police informed on Thursday.

170.title: Amazon to shut down its online learning platform in India from Aug 2023
170.article_body: Amazon will be shutting down its online learning vertical, Amazon Academy, in India starting August 2023. The company said it will refund the full fee to those enrolled in the current batch and customers will have access to course material until October 2024. While Amazon didn't specify a reason, a report said this is a part of Amazon's cost-cutting measures.

171.title: TMC writes to poll body over 'foreigners' campaigning for BJP in Gujarat
171.article_body: TMC National Spokesperson Saket Gokhale wrote to ECI demanding urgent action in connection with alleged involvement of "foreigners" in election campaigning for BJP in Gujarat. This came after BJP Gujarat tweeted a video. "Foreigners being used by BJP...in complete violation of election laws. Also, foreigners sound Russian, raising serious questions of interference in elections," Gokhale tweeted.

172.title: Inadequate: HC on compensation to Morbi tragedy victims' families
172.article_body: Gujarat High Court has criticised the state government over the compensation given to families of the people who died in the Morbi bridge collapse tragedy, calling it "inadequate and unrealistic". "The compensation paid to critically injured is also not enough," it added. Moreover, the court ordered the Gujarat government to conduct a survey of all bridges in the state.

173.title: Give extra measles vaccine dose to kids in vulnerable areas: Centre
173.article_body: The Centre has asked states and Union Territories to administer an additional dose of measles and rubella vaccines to children aged nine months to five years in vulnerable areas. This comes amid a rise in measles cases in some states, including Maharashtra and Bihar. The states have been asked to earmark wards and beds for effective management of measles cases.

174.title: Paytm's 75% stock decline is world's worst in 10 years among large IPOs
174.article_body: Paytm's parent company One 97 Communications has seen its shares decline 75% from its listing price.
