The price cap could be announced later on Wednesday after a meeting of EU ambassadors. EU has also proposed adding a number of grace periods to its cap legislation.

348.title: School timings in Haryana revised from Dec 1 over drop in temperature
348.article_body: Haryana government has announced that school timings have been revised with effect from December 1 over a drop in temperature. For schools taking classes in a single shift, the timings are 9:30 am-3:30 pm, while timings for schools taking classes in two shifts are 7:55 am-12:30 pm and 12:40 pm-5:15 pm. Timings for teachers and other staff remain unchanged.

349.title: Shraddha would’ve been alive if police had taken action, says father
349.article_body: Shraddha Walkar's father on Wednesday said that his daughter would've been alive if police had taken action against Aftab Poonawala based on the letter she had written in 2020. Shraddha submitted a written complaint to the Tulinj Police Station on November 23, 2020, alleging that Aftab had threatened to "kill her and cut her into pieces".

350.title: Nearly 100 huts, shops destroyed in fire in Assam's Karbi Anglong
350.article_body: Nearly 100 huts and shops were destroyed in a fire that broke out at Lahorijan in Assam's Karbi Anglong district near the Nagaland border on Wednesday, officials said. No injuries were reported in the fire. Police said that several cylinders burst in the fire, adding that one four-wheeler and three motorcycles were also damaged during the incident.

351.title: CBI sentences 10 people to imprisonment for bank fraud in 2013 in Hyd
351.article_body: The Special Judge for Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) cases in Hyderabad sentenced 10 people to various periods of rigorous imprisonment for involvement in bank fraud in 2013. In March 2013, the CBI registered a case against the accused for bank fraud and causing losses of over ₹4 crore to Bank of Maharashtra. A fine was also imposed on them.

352.title: Satyendar Jain to get food as per his religious beliefs in jail, says Delhi court
352.article_body: Approving AAP leader Satyendar Jain's request for "proper food", a Delhi court ordered Tihar administration to provide him with food as per his religious beliefs. Jain had complained that he was deprived of proper food in jail. As per Jain's lawyer, he eats food only after going to temple and has been eating only fruits ever since he was jailed.

353.title: Law & order in Raj has deteriorated under Ashok Gehlot regime: Thakur
353.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Wednesday criticised the Congress government in Rajasthan and alleged that the state has witnessed a deterioration in law and order under the Ashok Gehlot regime. Speaking to reporters in Jaipur, he said, "Everyday, some or the other news is coming from Rajasthan, be it about crimes against women or atrocities against...Dalits."

354.title: Cricketers openly doing politics, says AAP on Rivaba using Jadeja's pic
354.article_body: Responding to BJP candidate Rivaba Jadeja using her husband and Indian cricketer Ravindra Jadeja's image in her campaign posters, AAP MLA Naresh Balyan said that cricketers are now "openly doing politics". Congress candidate and Ravindra Jadeja's sister, Naynaba Jadeja, accused Rivaba of using children to gain sympathy. "In a way, it is called child labour," she said.

355.title: UK Supreme Court rules against Scottish independence vote
355.article_body: The UK Supreme Court on Wednesday ruled that Scotland does not have the power to conduct a fresh referendum on independence without the British government's assent. This is a setback for the semi-autonomous Scottish government, which wanted to hold an independence referendum next year. The British government has so far refused to approve the referendum plan.

356.title: Guv Koshyari wants to leave Maha: Ajit Pawar amid Shivaji remark row
356.article_body: NCP leader Ajit Pawar has claimed that Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari had expressed his desire to leave the state and be relieved from his post. "I...asked [Koshyari] to convey this to his seniors so that they consider his wish," he added. Pawar's remarks come after Koshyari's recent remark where he called Shivaji Maharaj an "icon of olden times".

357.title: 'Tantrik' pours 50 tubes of superglue on naked couple in Rajasthan forest, kills them
357.article_body: A 'tantrik' was arrested in Udaipur for killing a couple known to him after pouring 50 superglue tubes on their naked bodies in a forest. The victims, who were married to other people, were having an affair. The 'tantrik' told the man's wife about it. When the two found out, they conspired to defame him, after which he murdered them.

358.title: Sridevi's mom asked for ₹10 lakh for film, I said I'll pay ₹11 lakh: Boney
358.article_body: Producer Boney Kapoor recalled an incident where his wife Sridevi's mother had asked for ₹10 lakh fee on behalf of the late actress for a film. "I said I'll pay ₹11 lakh...I put a condition that the next film [Sridevi] signs, cannot be less than ₹15 lakh," the producer stated. He added that Sridevi was paid ₹15 lakh for 'Chandni'.

359.title: 30-year-old bike rider dies after getting hit by DJB truck
359.article_body: A 30-year-old motorbike-borne died after being hit by a Delhi Jal Board (DJB) truck in the Mangolpuri area, police said. According to reports, the truck, which is believed to be involved in the accident, was intercepted, but the accused escaped from the spot. CCTV footage is being scanned to establish the sequence of events, said a senior police official.

360.title: Brazilian influencer gets Elon Musk's name tattooed on forehead; pics surface
360.article_body: A Brazilian influencer named Rodrigo America, who considers the world's richest man Elon Musk his idol, has got the entrepreneur's name tattooed on his forehead. "What he's doing, what he's going to do, taking human beings to Mars, his name will go down in history," Rodrigo said about Musk. Rodrigo also has a rocket tattooed on his forehead.

361.title: After 16 years, CHB teachers get hike from ₹60 to ₹150 per hr in Maha
361.article_body: After 16 years, the Maharashtra government has increased the remuneration of clock-hour basis (CHB) teachers employed at higher secondary private schools from ₹60 per hour to ₹150 per hour. Meanwhile, CHB teachers of secondary private schools will now get ₹120 per hour. Unhappy with the hike, a teacher said, "With such meagre remuneration, it's very difficult to sustain in [Pune]."

362.title: Price of certain liquor to go up in Kerala as cabinet approves 4% increase in GST
362.article_body: Indian-made foreign liquor (IMFL) in Kerala will become costlier as the state cabinet on Wednesday approved a 4% increase in general sales tax (GST). Earlier in June, the state government had hinted at the possibility of a rise in IMFL rates after cost of raw materials increased. The liquor manufacturers have also been urging the government to increase the prices.

363.title: Kyiv residents to experience 'worst winter since WWII': Mayor
363.article_body: Kyiv's Mayor Vitali Klitschko said the 3 million inhabitants of the Ukrainian capital are set to experience one of the toughest winters in recent times due to Russian shelling on the city's infrastructure. "This is the worst winter since World War II," German newspaper Bild quoted Klitschko as saying. In the "worst case scenario", residents may be evacuated, he said.

364.title: Ex-superintendent of Pune orphanage jailed over allowing child marriage
364.article_body: A local court in Maharashtra has sentenced the ex-superintendent of a government-run orphanage in Pune's Baramati to one month in jail and levied a fine of ₹52,000 on her over a child marriage held there in 2014. Lata Vasantrao Rathod was found guilty under Section 11(1) of the Prohibition of Child Marriage Act and Section 506 (criminal intimidation) of IPC.

365.title: Search efforts continue after Indonesian quake, toll rises to 268
365.article_body: Over 12,000 Indonesian Army personnel were deployed on Wednesday to expedite search operations following the deadly earthquake that struck the country's main island of Java on Monday. Chief of National Disaster Mitigation Agency Suharyanto said so far 268 bodies have been recovered and at least 151 people are still missing. Nearly 600 people are receiving treatment for serious injuries.

366.title: Even Lalit Pandit's kids don't talk to me: Jatin Pandit
366.article_body: Music composer Jatin Pandit, speaking about his equation with his brother and music composer Lalit Pandit, has said that Lalit's children also don't talk to him. "I have told this 100 times. I am always ready. But it has to happen from both sides. But I have stopped saying anymore because I was refused so many times," he added.

367.title: 5.9-magnitude quake hits northwest Turkey, no major damage reported
367.article_body: An earthquake of 5.9 magnitude struck Duzce province in northwestern Turkey on Wednesday morning, said the country's Disaster and Emergency Management Presidency. No death or major damage was reported. The quake was followed by 35 aftershocks. Interior Minister Suleyman Soylu said at least 50 people were hospitalised with injuries. One of the injured is in critical condition.

368.title: Fawad Khan's Legend of Maula Jatt earns PKR 200 cr worldwide: Report
368.article_body: Pakistani film 'The Legend of Maula Jatt' has reportedly earned around PKR 200 crore worldwide. As per reports, the film collected PKR 80 crore domestically and PKR 120 crore from the overseas market. The film has also become the highest-earning Pakistani film to date. 'The Legend of Maula Jatt' featured Fawad Khan and Mahira Khan.

369.title: Drinking even less alcohol during pregnancy alters baby’s brain: Study
369.article_body: Drinking even less amount of alcohol during pregnancy can alter baby's brain structure and development, a new study stated. Researchers found that the right superior temporal sulcus (STS), a brain region involved in social cognition, audiovisual integration and language perception in the foetus exposed to alcohol, was shallower. STS has a great influence on language development during childhood.

370.title: Mangaluru blast case to be formally handed over to NIA: K'taka DGP
370.article_body: Karnataka DGP Praveen Sood on Wednesday said the Mangaluru autorickshaw blast case will be formally handed over to the National Investigation Agency (NIA) soon. Sood, along with Home Minister Araga Jnanendra, inspected the blast spot on the outskirts of Mangaluru and later held a meeting. Jnanendra said the accused had visited different places like Coimbatore and Kanniyakumari in Tamil Nadu.

371.title: 16-yr-old girl mowed down by bus after falling from scooter in Bengaluru
371.article_body: A 16-year-old girl was mowed down by a BMTC bus in Bengaluru after getting knocked off her mother's scooter on Tuesday. The bus reportedly swerved to the right and knocked down their scooter, following which the victim, Layashri, her brother, Yashwin, and their mother, Priyadarshini, fell to the side. Layashri and Yashwin were on their way to their school.

372.title: Russia declared a state sponsor of terrorism by European Parliament
372.article_body: The European Parliament on Wednesday designated Russia as a state sponsor of terrorism. It argued that Moscow's military strikes on civilian targets such as energy infrastructure, hospitals, schools and shelters violated international law. The move is largely symbolic, as the European Union does not have a legal framework in place to back it up.

373.title: Am I doing hawala business: T'gana Minister Malla Reddy after IT raids
373.article_body: A day after the Income Tax department conducted raids at the properties belonging to Telangana Labour Minister Malla Reddy and his son-in-law in Secunderabad, the Minister accused the BJP of creating terror. "Am I doing hawala business?" he asked. "BJP and Modi government are deploying IT officers to 50 different places and houses to create terror," Reddy said.

374.title: Congress model means corruption, nepotism, it has ruined Guj & India: PM Modi
374.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday accused Congress of indulging in vote bank politics and creating rifts between people of different castes and districts to be in power. "Congress model means corruption, nepotism...and casteism," he said. "This model has ruined not just Gujarat but also India. This is...why we've to try hard today to take the country ahead," he added.

375.title: Country-made bomb explodes near bus stop in Telangana's Siddipet
375.article_body: A country-made bomb exploded near the Husnabad RTC bus stand in Telangana's Siddipet on Tuesday, but no injuries were reported in the incident. According to the police, the bomb exploded around 9:45 am, when a fruit vendor ran his cart over it. Police later discovered five such bombs in the bushes near the bus stop and are investigating the case.

376.title: IMD predicts heavy rains in B'luru, other parts of Karnataka till Nov 24
376.article_body: India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted heavy rainfall till November 24 in Bengaluru. Showers are also expected in Karnataka's coastal districts of Udupi, Dakshina Kannada and Uttara Kannada, along with the hilly regions of Shivamogga, Kodagu and Hassan. Bengaluru on Monday reported a minimum temperature of 13.9°C, the lowest temperature recorded in the city in November in a decade.

377.title: Dubai's 100-storey 'hypertower' to be the world's tallest residential building
377.article_body: Plans have been unveiled to build a 100-storey 'hypertower' in Dubai, which the developers claim will be the world's tallest residential building. Named 'Burj Binghatti Jacob & Co Residences', the hypertower will have diamond-shaped spires at the top to resemble a crown. The building will house a dedicated concierge team, offering services such as daycare, bodyguard, chauffeur and private chef.

378.title: It is dead: Lionel Messi on Argentina's morale after losing to Saudi Arabia
378.article_body: On being asked about the team's morale after losing to Saudi Arabia 1-2 in their 2022 FIFA World Cup opener, Argentina captain Lionel Messi said, "The truth? Dead." He added, "It is a very hard blow because we did not expect to start in this way." He further said, "We've to prepare for what is coming, we've to win."

379.title: Doesn't matter what people say: Hardik on criticism over Samson, Umran's non-selection
379.article_body: Referring to criticism over not selecting Umran Malik and Sanju Samson in the playing XI in the recently concluded T20I series against New Zealand, Hardik Pandya said, "Doesn't matter what people say." He added, "This is my team and I will pick the best side after discussing with the coach." He further stated that everyone will get their chances.

380.title: Cristiano Ronaldo fined ₹50 lakh for smashing young fan's phone
380.article_body: Portugal captain Cristiano Ronaldo has been fined £50,000 (₹50 lakh) and handed a two-match suspension by Football Association (FA) for smashing a young fan's phone following Manchester United's defeat against Everton at Goodison Park in April. Manchester United on Tuesday terminated Ronaldo's contract by mutual consent following his interview with Piers Morgan, wherein he had criticised the club.

381.title: Farmer leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal's fast enters fifth day
381.article_body: Bharti Kisan Union (Ekta Sidhupur) President Jagjit Singh Dallewal's fast entered its fifth day on Wednesday. Dallewal has pledged to fast unto death till the Punjab government agrees to various demands of the farmers, including cancellation of cases against farmers for burning paddy residue. "Even if I die, I appeal to [farmers] to carry out their protests [peacefully]," he said.

382.title: BBL doesn't have enough money to buy Suryakumar Yadav: Glenn Maxwell
382.article_body: Praising world number one T20I batter Suryakumar Yadav, Australia all-rounder Glenn Maxwell said, "He is frustratingly consistent. Yadav is so much better than everyone else." He added, "[BBL] doesn't have enough money...to buy Suryakumar Yadav. Cricket Australia will have to sack every player, even the centrally contracted ones to gather the money and hope that he agrees [to play BBL]."

383.title: No scene happened: Dalip on Jaya Prada slapping him during rape scene
383.article_body: Actor Dalip Tahil has said that he still reads reports about him getting slapped by actress Jaya Prada after he lost control during a rape scene. Refuting such reports, he stated, "Let me clarify...I have never shared screen space with Jaya Prada ji. I was keen to do so but never got the chance. No such scene ever happened."

384.title: It hurts when good music doesn't work with audience: Amit Trivedi
384.article_body: Music composer Amit Trivedi said that he was "hurt" and "depressed" when audience rejected the music of 'Bombay Velvet', 'Luv Shuv Tey Chicken Khurana' and other films. "They were so good. I thought they'd work. But people didn't understand," he shared. The musician expressed that he has accepted and understood that audience's reaction to his music isn't in his control.

385.title: Bengaluru-based tech companies raised record $7.5 bn in 2022: Report
385.article_body: Bengaluru-based tech companies have raised a record $7.5 billion in venture capital funding in the first three quarters of 2022, according to a report from London & Partners in partnership with Dealroom. Bengaluru features among the top 10 cities globally for most investments in last five years. Bengaluru is attracting more investments than Singapore, Paris and Berlin, the report mentioned.

386.title: Want to know if there was 'hanky panky': SC to govt on EC Arun Goel's appointment
386.article_body: The Supreme Court asked the Centre on Wednesday to produce before it the file related to the appointment of Election Commissioner Arun Goel. A five-judge Constitution bench said it wants to know whether there was any "hanky panky" in Goel's appointment as Election Commissioner. The court raised questions as Goel was recently given retirement from service.

387.title: Wasn't giving me the joy I wanted: Parvathy on not doing Hindi films
387.article_body: Actress Parvathy Thiruvothu said that after 'Qarib Qarib Singlle', Bollywood offered her same sort of roles. "It wasn't giving me the joy that I wanted," she said, adding that the Malayalam film industry was giving her different characters, concepts and genres. However, she said she'd soon announce a Hindi project in which she'd be seen in a supporting role.

388.title: Musk names South Korea among top options for EV factory in Asia
388.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has said that South Korea is among its top candidate locations to build an electric vehicles (EVs) factory in Asia, South Korean presidential office said. During a video call with President Yoon Suk Yeol, Musk said he would make the decision on EVs factory after reviewing investment conditions in other countries, including labour, technology and infrastructure.

389.title: Dutch investor Prosus values its 9.67% Byju's stake at $578 mn
389.article_body: Netherlands-based investor Prosus valued its 9.67% stake in Byju's at $578 million by the end of the September quarter. The private investor also valued Byju's at $5.97 billion and identified the edtech unicorn as a non-controlling financial investment. In its 2022 annual report, Prosus said that it had invested a total of $536 million in Byju's.

390.title: Satyendar Jain claims video of eating food in Tihar jail is doctored
390.article_body: Delhi minister Satyendar Jain's lawyers have claimed that the latest leaked video, which shows the AAP leader eating food inside his cell at Tihar jail, was based on doctored clips. Jain's lawyers told the court that the leaked video was from September and comprised tapes from different dates. The ED had the video, said Advocate Abhijit Shankar, representing Tihar jail.

391.title: Mumbai man sheds 10 kg in 2 months to donate part of liver to son
391.article_body: A Mumbai man, who weighed 86 kg, lost 10 kg in two months to donate part of his liver to his two-year-old son. After working out and following a strict diet plan, Yogesh Vaze got ready for the surgery. His son, born with a rare condition called Progressive Familial Intrahepatic Cholestasis Type 2, underwent a successful liver transplant in October.

392.title: He's a petty troll: Cong leader on Assam CM calling Rahul 'Saddam Hussein'
392.article_body: Congress leader Manish Tewari, on Wednesday, said that Assam CM, who called Rahul Gandhi "Saddam Hussein", sounded like a "cheap troll". "In public life, it is very important that we maintain the decorum of language and propriety," Tewari said. Citing the Morbi bridge collapse as an example, Tewari said that BJP has become "arrogant".

393.title: Received 55,497 user data requests from India in 1st half of 2022: Meta
393.article_body: Meta said that it received 55,497 requests from India to provide user data in the first half of 2022, second to the US which asked for similar information. Meta also said that it restricted access in India to 597 items in response to directions from the IT Ministry. Notably, India made 50,382 such requests in the second half of 2021.

394.title: Being associated with Dharma made me easy target to hate: Janhvi
394.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor has agreed that being associated with Karan Johar and Dharma Productions has made her an "easy target to hate". The actress made her Bollywood debut with 'Dhadak', which was co-produced by Karan Johar. Talking about it, Janhvi said she doesn't regret being launched by the filmmaker but feels "unbelievably lucky and privileged".

395.title: Meaningless cricket played meaninglessly: Harmison on Eng's 0-3 series loss
395.article_body: Reacting to England's 0-3 whitewash in the recently concluded ODI series against Australia, ex-England pacer Steve Harmison said, "It was meaningless cricket played in a meaningless way." Sharing his opinion on the whitewash, ex-England wicketkeeper Matt Prior stated, "It was an absolute pumping. There was only one team that turned up all series. It was all a little bit inevitable."

396.title: Lightrock acquires majority stake in Sukoon Healthcare for $15 million
396.article_body: Lightrock India has made an investment of $15 million and acquired a significant stake in Sukoon Healthcare, a Gurugram-based psychiatric inpatient unit. Saleem Asaria, a partner at Lightrock India, will assume executive chairman's role, while founders Vidit Bahri and Kanishk Gupta will assume senior leadership roles. Sukoon plans to scale to multiple locations and expand specialist services.

397.title: World's most expensive drug approved to treat hemophilia at $3.5 million a dose
397.article_body: US regulators approved CSL Behring's hemophilia B gene therapy, a one-off infusion that costs $3.5 million a dose, making it the most expensive medicine in the world. Hemophilia B is a genetic bleeding disorder. Hemgenix works by delivering a gene that can produce the missing clotting factors into the liver, where it starts working to make the Factor IX protein.

398.title: SC to have special bench from next week to deal with tax cases: CJI
398.article_body: Chief Justice of India (CJI) DY Chandrachud on Tuesday said that the Supreme Court will have a special bench to exclusively deal with tax cases from next week onwards. "There will be a special bench from next week onwards, on Wednesdays and Fridays, to deal with direct and indirect sales tax matters solely," CJI Chandrachud told a group of lawyers.

399.title: Married man shoots girlfriend dead in OYO hotel in Delhi, tries to kill himself
399.article_body: A 38-year-old married man named Praveen allegedly shot his girlfriend Geeta in the chest and killed her following an argument in an OYO hotel in Delhi. He also tried to kill himself by shooting in the head, however, he survived and is hospitalised. According to reports, Praveen was arrested in another murder case earlier and is currently out on bail.

400.title: Mumbai man cuts b'day cake at crematorium, hosts biryani party to bust myth
400.article_body: A man from Mumbai's Kalyan reportedly celebrated his 44th birthday at a crematorium to bust myths associated with such places. Gautam More not only cut his birthday cake there but also hosted a biryani party for family and friends at Kalyan's Mohane crematorium. More is a member of Maharashtra Andhashraddha Nirmoolan Samiti. He runs campaigns to create awareness against superstitions.

401.title: Hyd Police invoke PD Act against woman involved in human trafficking
401.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police on Tuesday invoked Preventive Detention (PD) Act against a woman, Nusrath Begum, who was allegedly involved in human trafficking. In 2022, Nusrath was involved in two cases of human trafficking for the sake of prostitution, police stated. Nusrath was arrested in May for allegedly kidnapping and forcing a minor into prostitution and was also arrested in October.
